summary: Completed testing of Member and Role Management feature on 'Meine Organisation' page. All backend endpoints and frontend UI are working correctly. Admins can see organization members, change roles using dropdown, and role changes persist in the database.
passed_tests: Backend: Login with demo account (demo@kommunalcrm.de / demo123) - returns token and user data
Backend: GET /api/organizations/demo-org/members - returns member list with name and email
Backend: Role change persists in database (verified via GET after PUT)
Backend: All 6 valid German role values work (fraktionsvorsitzender, stv_fraktionsvorsitzender, fraktionsgeschaeftsfuehrer, ratsmitglied, sachkundiger_buerger, mitglied)
Backend: Nonexistent user returns 404 on role update
Frontend: Login page loads with 'Demo: Fraktion' button
Frontend: Navigation to 'Meine Organisation' page works
Frontend: 'Mitglieder' card displays with member list (name and email shown)
Frontend: Role dropdown opens with all 6 German role options
Frontend: Role change via dropdown triggers backend API call
Frontend: Toast notification 'Mitgliederrolle aktualisiert' appears after role change
Frontend: Role change persists after page refresh
critical_code_review_comments: MyOrganization.jsx has proper data-testid attributes for testing (org-members-card, org-member-*, org-member-role-trigger-*, etc.)
Role management correctly checks for admin role before showing dropdown (non-admins see read-only badge)
API client (base44Client.js) properly implements organizations.getMembers() and users.updateRole() methods
context_for_next_testing_agent: Member and role management feature is fully working. The feature allows admins on the 'Meine Organisation' page to see all organization members with their names and emails, and change their roles using a dropdown selector. Role changes are saved to the database via PUT /api/users/{user_id}/role endpoint. German role labels are: Fraktionsvorsitzender, 1. stv. Fraktionsvorsitzender, Fraktionsgeschäftsführer, Ratsmitglied, Sachkundiger Bürger, Mitglied.
